text: Coleridge George Emerson Goode (29 November 1914 â€“ 2 October 2015) was a British Jamaican-born jazz bassist. He was best known for his long works with alto saxophonist Joe Harriott. On 18 May 2011 Goode was honoured with the Services to Jazz Award at the Parliamentary Jazz Awards, held at the House of Commons. He died on 2 October 2015, the year after he turned 100. ==References== Category:1914 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Bassists Category:British centenarians Category:British jazz musicians Category:Musicians from Kingston, Jamaica
title: Coleridge Goode
